page.title: 13Education Part 1
page.content: The School and School house were built in 1839.Classes before then were held in the Church tower.Pupils have always travelled in from nearby towns.Owing to changing methods in farming and the reduction of the school leaving age in Primary schools to 11 the roll has steadily decreased.In 1880 there were 4 teachers and 150 pupils aged up to 14.Now there are 2.2 teachers and 21 pupils.There is 1 part time care taker ,1 mid-day assistant,1 canteen super- visor and 1 part time secretary.There is oil fired central heating and elec- tric lighting.Toilet facilities are still primitive.The meals are brought in from Crewe.School opens at 9.0am but as 70% travel in ,school seldom starts on time.There is a mid morning and a mid afternoon break and lunch is taken at 12.Most children bring sand- wiches.School ends atb 3.30 pm.
